column1: successor_desc;This character is one of the former generals and vassals of the Yunani conqueror of Rajasthan
column2: who died early in his reign.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: yunakshetra_bloodline_desc;A ruler who claims descent from the prestigious Yukonama dynasty of Yunakshetra.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: he managed to carve out a realm far bigger than that of the great yunani conqeror himself.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: purandara_bloodline_desc;A minor king who subjugated the warring states of Southern India and united the chaotic region under one massive empire;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
laskandar_bloodline_desc;The great yunani conqueror who established a realm stretching from Gujarat to the Indus River. He claimed descent from Ioannes Karasci himself;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

gangaraja_bloodline_desc;The greatest ruler of the Sharma dynasty that once dominated north India. His reign is widely regarded as a golden age that brought stability and prosperity to the realm.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
british_invasion_desc;We can wage a war to bring the Indian lands under the Queen's authority;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
unite_the_ganges_desc;Reform the ancient empire of the Sharma dynasty
column2: centred around the Ganges river.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: integrate_yunan_desc;The coastal regions of Maharashtra had been conquered by the Yunani of Mumbai centuries ago. However
column2: a strong Maharashtrian king can bring these regions back into the folds of the kingdom.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: form_madhya_pradesh_desc;Unite central India into one kingdom.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
form_himalayas_desc;Become the emperor of the mountain lands.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
expand_mughalstan_desc;It is said that the emperors of ancient Mughalstan ruled a realm stretching from the Indus in the west to Bengal in the east. By controlling these regions
column2: the newly-reestablished empire of Mughalstan can claim sovereignty over these lands.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: unite_the_ganges_TOOLTIP;Control all counties bordering the Ganges river;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
form_laskandar_empire_desc;Reunite the lands once conquered by Laskandar.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
form_laskandar_empire_tt;To be recognized as a true successor of Laskandar
column2: you must unite Rajasthan
column3: Gujarat and the Sindh under your rule before 2655. However
column4: if you were to conquer Punjab
column6: you shall be able to rule these regions as their lawful sovereign.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC_cricket_game_start;The stadium has been prepared and the players have been summoned. It is time for the cricket match to begin!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA_cricket_game_start;I will cheer my team on from the stands!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB_cricket_game_start;You know what? I'm going to join them on the pitch!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
TXT_EVTOPTB_cricket_game_start;You descend from the stands and join the game.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC_cricket_game_win;After several long and brutal overs
column2: my team finally emerges victorious. As my section of the stands erupts into cheers
column3: I cannot help but join in.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_cricket_game_win;I knew I was right to support them!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC_cricket_game_lose;After several long and brutal overs
column2: my team has been soundly defeated. As I hear the other section of the stands cheer in celebration
column3: I bury my head in my hands.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: my team finally emerges victorious! My hips are bruised purple
column3: but the cheering from the stands makes the pain evaporate.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC_cricket_game_personal_lose;Despite trying my absolute hardest to win
column2: my team has been soundly defeated. I collapse onto the floor
column4: as the crowd cheers for my opponents.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the ritual requires one final step. The captain of the other team murmurs a final prayer before being decapitated. His blood will serve as the ultimate offering to the Red King.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
the ritual requires one final step. The captain of my team whispers an apology to his family before being decapitated. His blood will serve as a bitter offering to the Red King.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_cricket_game_captain_sacrifice;A fitting conclusion to the game.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB_cricket_game_captain_sacrifice;It's a shame it had to turn out this way...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: and the attendees begin to return home. The people must surely have been pleased
column3: and it is thanks in large part to my own wealth and diligence.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: a prestigious sport beloved of the masses;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: neovedic_DESC;The Neovedic faith represents a partial revival of worship of ancient vedic Gods such as Indra
column2: Agni
column4: who had mostly fallen out of worship in the centuries leading up to the event. Neovedics believe that the event was a result of the wrath of the old gods
column5: who were angry at humanity for slipping into decadent ways and failing to worship and honor them. Rituals

column1: naxalite_DESC;Formed from a blend of Indian tribal religion and a foreign creed imported to the subcontinent before the Event
column2: the Maunaxites have always been an insular and beleaguered group
column3: used to withstanding contempt and attacks from outsiders. The faith chiefly reveres Maushiva
column5: who inevitably rises up to destroy corrupt rulers and raise the poor and oppressed. Other deities worshipped include Vishnu
column9: as in every other part of India

column1: naxalite_reformed_DESC;Formed from a blend of Indian tribal religion and a foreign creed imported to the subcontinent before the Event
column2: the Maunaxites have always been an insular and beleaguered group
column3: used to withstanding contempt and attacks from outsiders. The faith chiefly reveres Maushiva
column5: who inevitably rises up to destroy corrupt rulers and raise the poor and oppressed. The faith has now been reformed
column6: adding a priestly hierarchy and formalised texts
column7: enabling it to more effectively resist the encroachment of other faiths.;;;;;;;;x

column2: Hinduism began to split into two broad schools of thought - one highly Nationalistic and dogmatic
column3: and the other pluralistic and devoted strenuously to social reform. 'Neo-Vedantic' is a word originally used by the Bharatva to disparage the latter movement
column4: claiming that it was not authentically Hindu and represented a break from Vedic tradition. Despite their best efforts
column5: the name has stuck. Neo-Vedantics are highly concerned with the social advancement of all peoples and do not believe that India needs to be reserved strictly for Hindus. They reject the caste system and discrimination against women
column6: arguing that they are incompatible with true Dharma. Though less aggressive than the Bharatva
column7: they are not pacifistic and are willing to fight in the defense of their religion.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: bharatva_DESC;Bharatva is an ideology that came to dominate many parts of India in the chaos following the Event. Basing itself on traditional Vedic beliefs and Scriptures
column2: it is a highly dogmatic religion focused on the belief that India is a holy land belonging only to the Indians
column3: and that traditional Hindu beliefs and practices are essential to being a 'true' Indian. The Bharatva believe that at various points in history
column4: various Asura (Demon) Kings attempted to destroy India
column7: and the Britishers. They were stopped by various legendary hindu rulers throughout history
column8: except for the final Asura king
column10: who managed to plunge the subcontinent into an age of darkness
column11: commonly known as the event. They call for the unification of all Indians under the aegis of a Bharatva ruler and seek to establish a Vedic society
column12: to prevent something similar from ever happening again. Their resulting antagonism toward non-Dharmic religions results in them being the most aggressive of all Indian religions.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: form_gandhara_desc;Unite the kingdom of Gandhara in the name of dharma.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
form_annara_desc;Unite the kingdom of Annara in the name of dharma.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

novelist_hindu_desc;This character is a follower of the Novelistic school of thought. This school was born out of the encounter between the dharmic faiths of India and the mystical beliefs of the Novelists.  Novelist tales were reinterpreted by their Dharmic overlords
column2: which led to drastic changes in the faith. Ancient and mystic novelist tomes depicting the exploits of past gods and heroes were syncretized
column3: and elements from Hindu legends were incorporated into the Novelist canon. Adherents of the faith have a diverse set of beliefs
column4: but one of their core beliefs is that the Lord Vishnu will reincarnate upon the earth as Erul Avatara
column5: in order to defeat the Asura king of Mordor
column7: and thereby saving the world from Adharma.;Title;Title;;Title;;;;;;;;;x

column1: parjanya_hindu_desc;This character is a follower of the Parjanyan school of thought
column2: adherents of which worship Parjanya as their chief diety. An obscure and nearly forgotten rain god
column3: Parjanya suddenly rose in popularity when a ruler received a vision of him
column4: which resulted in the ruler encouraging his worship and dedicating temples to him
column5: while also facilitating the spread of his cult throughout the Bharatva world.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: form_indian_empire_desc;Unite the vast lands of India under your rule;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: Ruler of the Punjab
column8: Mahabasileya Yama! Within a few short decades
column9: not only have you remade Laskandar's shattered realm
column10: but managed to far surpass the conqueror and his empire in every possible way. You have managed to subjugate every realm west of the indus and east of the ganges
column11: and it is said that Hindu Rajas
column12: Bengali Sultans and Deccani Emperors alike regard you with fear and awe. Suffice it to say that you and your bloodline shall be immortalized in the history books.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
